In Bucklands Windows NEAT, the fittest genomes in each species are kept fro=
m the previous generation (elitism). These are not mutated.  Therefore, is =
it correct that there should be no reason to update their fitness scores?

=
My NEAT application uses the neural nets in a simulation.  An unmutated neu=
ral net will return the same output and therefore fitness each time.

To sa=
ve run time, I only update newly mutated or crossovered genomes.
